abstract: JPMorgan Chase, the first of the largest U.S. banks to report fourth-quarter results, may say profit more than tripled from the depths of the financial crisis in 2008 on a rebound in investment-banking fees.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase, the first of the largest U.S. banks to report fourth-quarter results, may say profit more than tripled from the depths of the financial crisis in 2008 on a rebound in investment-banking fees.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase, the first of the largest U.S. banks to report fourth-quarter results, may say profit more than tripled from the depths of the financial crisis in 2008 on a rebound in investment-banking fees.

headline.main: JPMorgan May Report Profit Leap on Banking Fees
